item.title: The Evolution of Asynchronous JavaScript
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: One of JavaScript’s strengths is how it handles asynchronous code. Async is one of the most important and often misunderstood part of Javascript or any other language. Async is hard because we, as human beings, can’t do two conscious actions at once and think about both of them at the same moment. In this talk […]
item.content:encoded: One of JavaScript’s strengths is how it handles asynchronous code. Async is one of the most important and often misunderstood part of Javascript or any other language. Async is hard because we, as human beings, can’t do two conscious actions at once and think about both of them at the same moment. In this talk we will see how asynchronous JavaScript evolved over the years. It all started with callbacks… and it landed on generators!
